did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Diaries, correspondence, memoranda, reports, writings, clippings, and printed matter, relating to Romanian politics and diplomacy, and to Romanian-Soviet negotiations, 1931-1932. Also available on microfilm (24 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: May be used only if name of user and copy of any publication based on the collection are made available to Mme M. Y. Antoniade.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: May be used only if name of user and copy of any publication based on the collection are made available to Mme M. Y. Antoniade.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nicolae Titulescu papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1974.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Increments may have been received since this finding aid was prepared. Please check Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat to find the full extent of the collection.

chronitem.event: Born, Craiova, Romania
Obtained juris doctorate from the University of Paris
Appointed law professor, University of Iasi, Romania
Appointed law professor, University of Bucarest, Romania
Elected to the Romanian Parliament
Minister of Finance
Forced to leave Romania for exile in Paris
Member, Romanian National Committee in Paris
Appointed delegate to the Paris Peace Conference. Participated in the negotiations and signed the Treaty of Trianon for Romania
Minister of Finance
Permanent Delegate to the League of Nations
Ambassador to Great Britain
Romanian representative in the Council of the League of Nations
Minister of Foreign Affairs
Romanian delegate to the Conference on Reparations in the Hague
President of the 11th and 12th sessions of the Assembly of the League of Nations
Minister of Foreign Affairs in Juliu Maniu Cabinet
Minister of Foreign Affairs in Vaida-Voevod Cabinet
Chief of the Romanian Delegation to the Monetary and Economic Conference in London
Minister of Foreign Affairs in Ion G. Duca Cabinet
Minister of Foreign Affairs in Gheorghe Tatarescu Cabinet
Minister of Foreign Affairs in reconstructed Cabinet
Died, Cannes, France

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Diaries, correspondence, memoranda, reports, writings, clippings, and printed matter, relating to Romanian politics and diplomacy, and to Romanian-Soviet negotiations, 1931-1932. Also available on microfilm (24 reels).

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Biographical material, certificates, clippings, commendations, congratulatory letter, curricula vitae, invitation, lists, official government documents, and tributes, relating to Nicolae Titulescu's life and career as diplomat and statesman, arranged alphabetically by physical form
Carbon copies of handwritten personal notes, correspondence, memoranda, telegrams, etc., arranged chronologically into 187 notebooks
Correspondence, arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent
Interview, memoirs, tributes, speeches, and writings, arranged chronologically by title

Charts, correspondence, memoranda, articles, reports, telegrams, minutes of meetings, lists, notes, official government documents, clippings and other printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject

One print of a painting by Brenner depicting the inn in Talloires, France, where Nicolae Titulescu met secretly with Maksim Litvinov on May 28, 1937; and one print of a portrait depicting Nicolae Titulescu, n.d.
Four microfilm reels of Nicolae Titulescu's notebooks

did.unittitle: Clippings on Nicolae Titulescu and Romanian politics
1936 August-October (after the dismissal of Nicolae Titulescu from the government)
Invitation from Gustav Stresemann to Nicolae Titulescu to come to Berlin, 1928 January

scopecontent.p: Various documents used by Jacques de Launay for his editing of Titulescu et l'Europe

did.unittitle: Document signed by President of the Council, Gheorghe Tatarescu, and two other members, in the name of the government, supporting the policy of Nicolae Titulescu, 1936 July 14 (in French)
Letter from the Regency Council asking Nicolae Titulescu to Bucarest for consultation, 1928
Lists of foreign representatives in London, 1925 April
Official communiqué in the hand of Gheorghe Tatarescu expressing to Nicolae Titulescu, in the name of the government, "his regards and confidence," n.d. (in French)
Telegram from Gheorghe Tatarescu to Nicolae Titulescu, announcing to the latter that he is no longer part of the government, 1936 August 29 (in French)
Nomination of Nicolae Titulescu as Romanian delegate to the Conference on the codification of international law in The Hague, 1930 March

scopecontent.p: Clippings

note.p: Please consult the Archives staff for an additional list of the most important items in this series
